sentences.sentence: To listen to this free New York Times Opinion podcast, follow these instructions.To listen to this free New York Times Opinion podcast, follow these instructions.Every Tuesday and Friday,Ezra Klein(@ezraklein) invites you into a conversation about something that matters.Available wherever you get your podcasts, including:·Apple Podcasts·Spotify·Google Podcasts·Pocket Casts·Amazon Music·Stitcher·RSS feedApple PodcastsSpotifyGoogle PodcastsPocket CastsAmazon MusicStitcherRSS feedTranscripts of each episode are available by midday.To listen to the podcast, follow these instructions:On a desktop or laptopYou can find all episodes atnytimes.com/ezra-klein-show.
Click the episode you want to hear and press the play button at the top of the page.On your iPhone or iPad1.
Open your podcast app.
It's a pre-loaded app called “Podcasts” with a purple icon.
You can also use your preferred podcast player.2.
Search for the series.
Tap on the “search” magnifying glass icon at the bottom of the screen, type in “The Ezra Klein Show” and select it from the list of results.3.
Follow.
Once on the series page, tap on the “follow” button to have new episodes sent to your phone free.
You may want to adjust your notifications to be alerted when a new episode arrives.4.
Or just sample.
If you would rather listen to an episode or two before deciding to follow, tap on the episode title from the list on the series page.
If you have an internet connection, you'll be able to stream the episode.On your Android phone or tablet1.
Open your podcast app.
There are a few different ones available for Android.
Any of them will be able to follow “The Ezra Klein Show.”2.
Search for the series.
Search for “The Ezra Klein Show” and select it from the list of results.3.
Follow.
Once on the series page, click on the word “follow” or the plus sign (this is different for each podcast player) to have new episodes sent to your phone free.4.
Or just sample.
If you would rather listen to an episode or two before deciding to follow, click on the episode title from the list on the series page.
If you have an internet connection, you'll be able to stream the episode.PHOTO: (PHOTOGRAPH BY The New York Times FOR THE NEW YORK TIMES)

documents.result_message: Our detector is highly confident that the text is written entirely by a human.
documents.inputText: To listen to this free New York Times Opinion podcast, follow these instructions.To listen to this free New York Times Opinion podcast, follow these instructions.Every Tuesday and Friday,Ezra Klein(@ezraklein) invites you into a conversation about something that matters.Available wherever you get your podcasts, including:•Apple Podcasts•Spotify•Google Podcasts•Pocket Casts•Amazon Music•Stitcher•RSS feedApple PodcastsSpotifyGoogle PodcastsPocket CastsAmazon MusicStitcherRSS feedTranscripts of each episode are available by midday.To listen to the podcast, follow these instructions:On a desktop or laptopYou can find all episodes atnytimes.com/ezra-klein-show. Click the episode you want to hear and press the play button at the top of the page.On your iPhone or iPad1. Open your podcast app. It’s a pre-loaded app called “Podcasts” with a purple icon. You can also use your preferred podcast player.2. Search for the series. Tap on the “search” magnifying glass icon at the bottom of the screen, type in “The Ezra Klein Show” and select it from the list of results.3. Follow. Once on the series page, tap on the “follow” button to have new episodes sent to your phone free. You may want to adjust your notifications to be alerted when a new episode arrives.4. Or just sample. If you would rather listen to an episode or two before deciding to follow, tap on the episode title from the list on the series page. If you have an internet connection, you’ll be able to stream the episode.On your Android phone or tablet1. Open your podcast app. There are a few different ones available for Android. Any of them will be able to follow “The Ezra Klein Show.”2. Search for the series. Search for “The Ezra Klein Show” and select it from the list of results.3. Follow. Once on the series page, click on the word “follow” or the plus sign (this is different for each podcast player) to have new episodes sent to your phone free.4. Or just sample. If you would rather listen to an episode or two before deciding to follow, click on the episode title from the list on the series page. If you have an internet connection, you’ll be able to stream the episode.PHOTO:  (PHOTOGRAPH BY The New York Times FOR THE NEW YORK TIMES)
